Gereltuya started her clothing and bag-retailing business in 2008, and over the years has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. She is well known for her high quality and highly fashionable products.

Now that her business is stable, Gereltuya wants to extend her range of products. She has rented a stall in the local market, and in the future wants to make her own store of the clothes. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, 39 years old and single, lives in Murang’a in Central Kenya, where she has practiced mixed farming for 12 years in addition to running a retail shop business. Her farm produces tea and vegetables which she sells locally. Droughts have and continue to be her main challenge.

Charity has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump. She says this will help her to pump water into her vegetable farm and increase her production. It will also reduce her farmhand costs since the water will be pumped.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (in the photo) sells Cambodian cake in her village. Her husband, Mean, is a construction contractor. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and two daughters- one child is a garment worker, another one has full-time employment, two are security guards and another one attends grade 6.

Sokhan is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to rebuild the house where she lives because the house is old and breaks, so she decided to make the rebuild.

loans.use: to rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Elsy Marilu

texts.es:
Elsy, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tostadas y panes con pollo, ella vive con su esposo y un hijo de 6 años de edad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 7:00pm, pues sus ventas de productos comestibles le permiten mantenerse todo el día con atención a los clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como pollos, condimentos, aceite, chicharrón, entre otros productos para el negocio. Esta compra le ayudara para mantener lo necesario y poder brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de Elsy es ayudar a su hijo, en sus estudios, por eso se esfuerza realizando las ventas a diario.
texts.en:
Elsy sells “pupusas” (a popular Salvadoran dish), tortilla snacks, and bread stuffed with chicken. She lives with her husband and 6-year-old son. Elsy has had the business for 2 years. She works every day from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm. Her sales of food products allow her to keep at it all day, providing attentive service to her customers.

Elsy is requesting a loan to buy products such as chicken, condiments, cooking oil, and pork cracklings, among other supplies for her business. This purchase will help her to maintain what's necessary in stock and offer better service to her customers.

Elsy's aspiration is to help her son continue his studies. That's why she works selling her meals each day.

loans.use: buy products for preparing meals to sell: chicken, condiments, cooking oil, and pork cracklings.

loans.name: Horloosuren

texts.en: Horloosuren is 53 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away recently. Her son is a college student. Horloosuren started a meat trading business in 2006. Over the years she gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her product demand is increasing. Therefore, she's requesting 800,000 MNT to buy additional supplies. She's a strong and hardworking woman who says, "It has been a big impact for us the fact that my husband passed away. However, that doesn't mean that I should feel sorry for myself and stop working. Instead, I have to work even harder."

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Seela

texts.en:
Seela is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Saleia. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Seela owns & operates a business involving making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Seela has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Seela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Seela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand the product offering.  Seela is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase a frying pan, flour, yeast, baking powder, plastic bags and cooking oil for her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Seela from SPBD. Seela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand Seela's business.

loans.use: to purchase frying pan, flour, yeast, baking powder, plastic bags and cooking oil.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Divina misericordia es el grupo formado por 14 mujeres de Ciudad del Este. Ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, y comentan que oyeron hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y su deseo es poder trabajar juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las miembros es la Sra. Ignacia, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de toda clase de marcas. Comenzó con la venta a solo los vecinos, pero después se abrió camino y hoy en día ya es una microempresaria exitosa y con muy buena clientela.  Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de es forma cumplir con loso pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Divina Misericordia" (Divine Mercy) is a group that consists of 14 women who are friends and neighbors from Ciudad del Este. They say that they heard a speech about the Women Entrepreneurs Program with Fundación Paraguaya. Their hope is to work together and be able to help one another.

One of the members is Sra. Ignacia. She says that she sells cosmetics of all types and brands. She started out selling only to neighbors, but afterwards she created a route and today she is already a successful microentrepreneur with a good customer base. Her wish is to continue working. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy cosmetics. This will allow her to restock so that she can fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for eventual resale.

loans.name: Moriku

texts.en:
Moriku is a 36 year-old business man, who lives in Juba Nimule. He is married with two children who are 16 and 14 years old; both of them go to school. 

Moriku runs a food store business; he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Moriku heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients as well through outreach and promotion carried out by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of SDG 600 to purchase more items like dry cells, sweets, soap, pens, and many others. In addition to this business; Moriku has no other source of income.

In five years time, Moriku hopes for a big food store in the market.  His major challenges include school fees and home expenses.

Moriku says that he is happy for finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items like dry cells, sweets, soap, pens, and many others.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Siufaga. She is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cooked food in the local community. Joan has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Joan joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Joan is now requesting a loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase a box of chicken, sausages, plastic plates and foil.  This is the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Joan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, sausages, plastic plates and foil.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is an 18-year-old woman living in the town of Patamea. She is married and does not have any children. Selina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Selina has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2012, Selina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Selina is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Selina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 3 kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Two of the kids are employed and the youngest one is a college student. Oyuntsetseg started her consumer retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. She sells items such as towels, flashlights, hairpins, bandeaus and socks, etc.. She is well known by her quality products and low prices. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my boy joined a college, I have to work even harder in order to support him." She's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Oyuntungalag is 32 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, and her daughter is a student.

Oyuntungalag started her shoe-retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. She buys her supplies, which are handpicked, of high quality and relatively inexpensive, from China, therefore earning her many customers. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy additional supplies to meet the growing customer demand. A sharp and hardworking woman, Oyuntungalag says, "I have a mission to open my own shoe store someday."

loans.use: to purchase spring shoes.

loans.name: Finauvale

texts.en:
Finauvale is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Taga. She is married and has 2 grown children. Finauvale owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Finauvale has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Finauvale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Finauvale has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. The previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Finauvale is requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, sausages to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Finauvale from SPBD. She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, sausages to sell.

loans.name: Perenise

texts.en:
Perenise is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Perenise owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Perenise has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Perenise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Perenise has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. Perenise is requesting a second loan of 1800 WST, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Perenise plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: This time Remedios is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her general store business. The general store that she previously funded, through NWTF and KIVA, continues to provide Remedios and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 32 year old Mabinty. She is a widow and has 2 children, aged 6 and 11. 

In 2008, Mabinty established her drinks and provisions business. She began her business because she was out of a job. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL4,000,000. Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more drinks. In the future, Mabinty plans to buy piece of land and build a house for herself. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Sulufaiga

texts.en:
Sulufaiga is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Sulufaiga owns & operates a service-based business providing taxi services to local community members. Sulufaiga has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sulufaiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Sulufaiga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2450 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Sulufaiga is now requesting a loan of 2850 WST, which will be used to purchase new tyres, service vehicle and taxi registration fees. This is the be the 5th loan taken out by Sulufaiga from SPBD. Sulufaiga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new tyres, service vehicle and taxi registration fees.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is applying for a loan of PHP 11,000, with which she intends to buy fertilizers and farm tools. The hog raising business, that she previously funded through KIVA and NWTF, continues to provide Rodelyn and her family with an income. She continues to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm tools.

loans.name: Conileus

texts.en: This is 46 year old Cornelius. He is married and has 2 children, aged 2 and 23 yrs. In 2006, he established his Entertainment Center, showing football matches and providing bar services. He began his business because he was out of a job. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Cornelius requires this loan in order to buy more drinks. He plans to improve more on this business and to buy another satellite dish to show many games. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is married and has 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Precy is 30 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Precy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount, through NWTF, to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Precy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Precy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma.aracelli

texts.en: This time, for her seventh loan, Ma. Araceli is borrowing PHP 14,000 to fund her vegetable farming business. The farming business that she previously funded, through NWTF ad KIVA, continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is 39 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is married and has three children between 2 and 12 years old. Two of the children are in school and they all live at home. 

For the past 2 years Garmai has been selling oil and rice. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil and rice for her business. A problem she faces is the rainy season. Her plan is to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve on business.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Salimata ; elle est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle   fait du commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle travaille avec le guichet depuis un bon bout de temps car elle a déjà eu 2 crédits. Son activité consiste à acheter pour revendre des habits, de l’encens, des chaussures, de la crème pour le corps. Salimata a comme charges : le payement de la facture de l’électricité ; et c’est comme cela qu’elle appui son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes  de la famille. Avec son époux qui se débrouille, Salimata à pour  objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie de son foyer.
texts.en:
The borrower is called Salimata. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She has been involved in commerce for 10 years.

Salimata has been working with the UIMCEC branch for a long while as she has already received 2 loans. Her business consists of buying and selling clothes, incense, shoes and body cream. Her financial obligations include paying the electricity bill, which is her way of supporting her husband in the management of the family's daily expenses. With her husband just getting by, Salimata aims to improve the living conditions of her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing, incense, shoes and body cream for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa que es de su propiedad, y esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Sialupe-Humantanga” perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque el cual esta a unos 15 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. En el caserío donde vive la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales.

Su actividad principal de Juana es dedicarse a la crianza, engorde y posterior comercialización de animales como. Ganado ovino, caprino, y aves de corral en su gran mayoría, los cuales al alcanzar el peso y tamaño ideal los ofrece en mercados de su caserío en donde ya tiene clientes fijos que son comerciantes de los mismos mercados.
Adicionalmente a eso se genera ingresos diarios vendiendo chicha de jora (bebida oriunda de los Incas), actividad que viene desarrollando ya un aproximado de 5 años.

Ahora Juana esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde y crecimiento rápido de sus animales y poder ponerlos a mejor precio, así de esa manera Juana obtendrá mayores ingresos con los que pueda cumplir con sus responsabilidades y de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and she and her husband have their own home and live there along with their two children.  The house is located in the rural settlement of “Sialupe-Humantanga,” which is part of the Lambayaque district, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  Most of the residents in her settlement raise and sell animals.

Juana’s principle activity is the raising and selling of livestock, such as sheep, goats, and coral birds in large numbers.  She sells them in the local markets where she has steady customers and who also sell things in the same markets.

She also generates income by selling corn chicha (a fermented drink of the Incas), and she’s been doing this for five years.

Juana is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, to buy balanced feed to better promote the growth of her livestock and be able to offer them at better prices.  In this way she can increase her income, allowing her to better meet her financial obligations, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Ma.ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children.

Ma. Ruby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, groceries and other miscellaneous items.

Ma. Ruby has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ma. Ruby aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack foods, groceries and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lea has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough to build a house for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Darika

texts.ru: Дарике 55 лет, имеет  троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, четыре года назад Дарика начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Дарики, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и пятнадцать овец, что позволяет получать примерно 8,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дарика обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и коз. Доходы Дарика планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Darika is 55 years old. She has three children. In the search of an income source for her family, four years ago Darika launched a livestock business with the starting capital of 5,000 KGS.Thanks to Darika’s hard work, her farm today has two dairy cows and 15 sheep, which allows her to earn about 8,000 KGS from sales of dairy and meat products. In order to grow her business further, Darika turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KGS for the purpose of buying sheep and goats. Darika plans to reinvest her revenues in expanding her livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Niño Salvador Group

texts.es:
Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, ellas son las integrantes del grupo Niño Salvador, el cual está integrado por 19 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas desean un mejor porvenir para sus hijos, para que de esa forma no pasen por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La Sra. Lidia es una persona que se destaca por su entusiasmo y su espíritu progresista, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, que ultimanete tiene mucha venta. Comenta que sus vecinos y personas de otras zonas compran de ella lo que vende, y es por ello que le va muy bien. Con mucho sacrificio y lucha ha logrado estar en en lugar en que se encuentra.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener mayor producto en stock. Está muy contenta por formar parte del programa de la fundación.
texts.en:
These individuals are known in their area as hardworking and determined women. They are from the group Niño Salvador (Savior Child), which consists of 19 women from the city of San Lorenzo. They desire a better future for their children, so they work in this manner in order for their children to avoid experiencing the same hardships that they had to endure.

Sra. Lidia is a person who is known for her enthusiasm and her progressive spirit. She says that she sells charcoal and generates many sales. Lidia says that her neighbors and people from other areas buy what she sells. For this reason, she has done very well. With great sacrifice and determination, she has been able to get to the place where she is now. She is requesting a loan to buy charcoal so that she can restock and have more inventory. Lidia is pleased to be part of the program with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for eventual resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with three children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, rice, and other miscellaneous items.

Grace has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending and hog raising.

Grace aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, rice, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Tagaymurod

texts.ru: Тагаймурод проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается перевозкой и развозкой пассажиров. В этой области он четыре года. Тагаймурод берет кредит для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Tagaymurod lives in the Muminobod district.  He is 49 years old, married and has four children.  He is involved in transportation and passenger taxi services.  He has been in this business for four years.  Tagaymurod is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Sang

texts.ru: Санг занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом он открыл не большой магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. В этой области он шесть лет. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sang is involved in sales.  He opened a small store with a mixed assortment of merchandise near his house.  He has been in this business for six years.  Sang is 56 years old, married and has one child.  He is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase necessary products

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo, sus hijos están ya separados pero le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a atender un negocio de productos domésticos, tiene 6 años en el negocio y lo instalo para tener una entrada de dinero y una ocupación que le ayudara para apoyar a su esposo. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para surtir la tienda como boquitas, galletas, dulces, embutidos, huevos, jabón, detergentes, con esta compra lograra diversificar los productos y así mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de María es ampliar su tienda, aumentar el número  de clientes y así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband.  Her children no longer live with her, but they help her financially.  She works at a small business selling household products.  She began the business six years ago to have a source of income and a job to help support her husband.  She is requesting this loan to buy products to stock the store, such as snacks, cookies, candy, deli meats, eggs, soap, and detergent.  With this purchase she will be able to diversify her products and thus improve sales.

Maria's aspiration is to expand her store, increase her number of clients, and so generate more income.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, candy, deli meats, eggs, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Elvia Idaluz

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer de 54 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de producto esika "empresa de cosmeticos y ropa por catalogo".

Su historia empezó luego que se separo de su esposo se dio cuenta que tenía que trabajar para sus hijos, su trabajo lo hace sola en el horario que requiera el cliente, si tiene dificultades son la inseguridad de las calles al entregar sus productos, no está casada, si tiene hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño más importante es tener su casa terminada la mitad es para mí y la otra parte es para alquilar. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de cosméticos, perfumes y cremas.
texts.en:
Elvia is a 54-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business selling Esika products (catalog cosmetics and clothing) over the next few years.

Elvia's business story started when she separated from her husband and realized that she had to work to support her children.  She works alone and her work hours depend on her customers' needs.  The difficulty she faces is the lack of safety in the streets when she goes out delivering her products.  Elvia is not married and her children are adults. Her biggest dream is to finish building her home.  She will live in half of the house and rent out the other half.  She would like this loan to buy cosmetics, perfume and creams.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume and creams

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abdul. He is married and has one child, aged 7 months. He has four additional dependents.  

In 2004, Abdul established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because after his high school education, there was no job. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,428,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more stock. In the future, Abdul plans to erect his own house and open a bigger shop. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more piglets and feed.

Gloria has been raising pigs for twenty-four years and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
56-year-old Mario lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He is married and has children.

Mario has been in the business of raising hogs for five years. He built a backyard piggery that he hopes to expand in the future. Mario earns about 10,000 PHP per month raising pigs. He works hard to provide his family with a better life. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins. Mario hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Nery Rosaura

texts.es:
Nery es una mujer de 57 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comedor-asadero.

Su historia empezó haciendo venta de almuerzo porque se separo de esposo y emprendió y emprendió un negocio de venta de almuerzo actualmente también tiene un asadero, su trabajo lo hace con su hija y mi horario es de lunes a sábado desde las 7:30 hasta las 18:00, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, si tiene 6 hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño más importante es incrementar el negocio de comidas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su negocio de comidas y asi comprar carnes, granos, bebidas.
texts.en:
Nery is a woman of 57 who has many ambitions for making her eatery and grill prosper in the coming years.

Her story begins with her selling lunches, because she separated from her husband, and launched a business selling lunches. Now she also has a grill. She works with her daughter, Monday to Saturday from 7:30am until 6:00pm. She doesn't have any difficulties in her business. She isn't married and has six adult children. 

Her most important dream is to increase her food business. That is why she wants the loan for her food business, in order to buy meat, grains, and drinks.

loans.use: To buy meat, grains, and drinks.

loans.name: Esther Elvira

texts.es:
Esther Elvira tiene 45 años vive en Union Libre, vive con el compañero tiene 7 hijos pero con ella solo viven 4 por que los demas son casado y viven fuera del recinto Sinabamba.

La ventanilla se llama SANABAMBA se encuentra ubicado en la Parroquia La Magdalena perteneciente al Canton Chimbo a 15 minutos de la oficina, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz.

Esther se dedica a la siembra de maiz, trigo y cebada en terrenos propios y una parte en terrenos arrendados, las compras las realiza en Comercial Prado.

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: urea, liquidos para curar las enfermedades de los cultivos y para semillas. El dinero le apoyado de gran manera por que a aumentado por ingresos en la produccion y para la familia, el sueño es ayudar a los hijos a terminar el estudio y seguir cosechando.

Le gusta trabajar tener animales para cuidar.
texts.en:
Esther Elvira is 45 years old and has a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband and has seven children.  She only lives with four of her children as the others are married and no longer live at home with her in Sinabamba.

This community bank is called 'Sanabamba' and it is located in La Magdalena parish, in Chimbo canton, 15 minutes from our office.  The members of the bank work in farming, growing corn.

Esther grows corn, wheat and barley.  She grows some of her crops on land which she owns and some on rented land.  She makes her purchases in Prado Shopping Center.

Esther is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as urea, liquids for combating crop disease, and seeds.  The money has been a great support to her as she has increased her income for her family.  Esther's dream is to help her children finish their studies and to continue farming.  She enjoys working and having animals to care for.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquids for combating crop disease, and seeds

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old and married with seven children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Emma has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Emely works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Emely is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries for her general store business.

Emely has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.ru: Хисрав житель города Куляб. Ему 25 лет. Он холост. Его отец милиционер, а брат находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Хисрав занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается полтора года. Кредит берет для закупа бычков с целью увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Khisrav is a resident of the city of Kulob.  He is 25 years old, single.  His father is a policeman, and brother is in the Russian Federation.  Khisrav is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for a year and a half.  He is requesting this loan to purchase bulls in order to increase livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда жительница района Дангара. Ей 33 года. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается торговлей. В основном она ходит по селам и продает детскую и мужскую одежду. Торговлей она занимается шесть лет. Также Мавджуда занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонной одежды.
texts.en: Mavdjuda is a resident of the Dangara district.  She is 33 years old, a widow and has four children.  She is involved in sales and primarily goes to villages to sell children's and men's clothing.  She has been involved in sales for six years.  Mavdjuda is also involved in sewing national dresses.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.  Cesar; es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es empresario minorista, el tiene un stand en uno d elos centros artesanales, el socio fabrica polos, casacas, busos, poleras con diseños andinos y tambien con caricaturas, el socio tiene una fabrica de confeccion y el distribuye al por mayor todo sus trabjo, el socio es un hombre muy trabajador y desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de telas, y de serigrafias para continuar con sus confecciones y distribuirlas por toda la ciudad. El socio compra telas y hilos para la fabricacion de sus polos, poleras, casacas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cesar is a member of 'Huayna Picchu' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Cesar is single and has two children.  He is a retail businessman and has a stand in a craft center.  He makes polo shirts, jackets, track suits and turtleneck sweaters with Andean designs and figures.  He has a clothing factory and distributes his products wholesale.  Cesar is a very hard-working man and he would like to invest his loan in buying fabrics and silk screen prints so that he can continue making his clothing and distributing it around the city.  He will buy fabric and threads for making his polo necks, turtlenecks and jackets.

Cesar is grateful to those who will take part in his dream in this way and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads for making polo shirts, turtleneck sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Сабоат жительница Гиссарского района. Она замужем. Ей 44 года. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама она имеет не большой участок земли, где занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом зерновых культур. В этой области она 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян картошки, пшеницы и закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Saboat is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 44 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  Saboat has a small plot of land, where she grows vegetables and plants cereal crops.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  Saboat is requesting this loan to buy potato and wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy potato and wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно более восьми лет занимается торговлей. Ей 43 года. Она открыла продуктовый магазин. Она разведена. У нее двое детей.  Барно берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Barno has been working in retail for over eight years. She is 43 years old. She keeps a grocery store. She is divorced and has two children. Barno is taking out a credit in order to purchase groceries.

loans.use: to purchase groceries [for resale].

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en: Marnie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marnie requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy snack foods and other groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years. Marnie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling kitchenware and ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more kitchenware to sell to customers. Mary Jane has been in this business for five years. Mary Jane earns more income from operating a general store.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchenware to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has no children. He has two additional dependents. In 2005, Mohamed established his business selling drinks, water, and recharge cards. He began his business because of his low income. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more inventory. In the future, Mohamed plans to bring in more essential products. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.ru: Муминджону 36 лет, он разводит дома овец и коз. Его жена помогает по уходу за скотом. Они также продают шерсть ангорских коз, их шерсть очень знаменитая в нашей области, из  вяжут теплую одежду. Они занимаются этим делом более 20 лет. Муминджон первый кредит получил у нас в 2010 году. Ему понравилось условия кредитования, с прошлого кредита он приобрел несколько голов коз и от проданной шерсти получил неплохой доход. Сейчас он также хочет купить скот для этого он получает у нас кредит. Муминджон благодарен КИВА за финансовую поддержку, и что может получить возможность улучшить своё будущее.
texts.en: Muminjon is 36 years old. He raises sheep and goats. His wife helps him take care of the livestock. They also sell mohair, which is very famous in their area and is used in knitting warm clothes. They have been engaged in this activity for over 20 years. Muminjon got his first loan in 2010. He liked the lending terms. With his first loan, Muminjon bought several head of goats and made a good profit from selling mohair. He would also like to buy livestock with another loan. That is why he requests a loan. Muminjon is grateful to KIVA for financial support and an opportunity to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a few goats

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она занимается торговлей. В этой области она два года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nargis lives in the city of Kulob. She is a divorced 23-year-old woman with two children. Nargis has been in sales business for two years.  She would like to get a loan to buy products in order to increase the turnover.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 47 лет, замужем и имеет  троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1999 году Гулнара начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с займа в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и двенадцать овец, что позволяет ежемесячно получать примерно 15,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulnara is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Seeking sources of income for her family, Gulnara started her own business of animal husbandry from a loan of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's dedicated work, her farm today counts two dairy cows and twelve sheep, which brings in around 15,000 som per month from the sale of dairy and meat products. In order to further develop her business, Gulnara turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional head of livestock. Gulnara is planning on investing the earnings from the loan in further increase of the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sayfuddin

texts.ru: Сайфуддину 54 года. Он занимается откормом коз. Он также работает в колхозе пастухом. У него в колхозе есть стадо, где  пасутся более 200 коз. Имея большой опыт в разведении скота, он также пасет сам коз на пастбище. Учитывая суровые условия, он отправляет свое стадо в горы, и зимой пригоняет обратно. Его жена не работает, но получает пенсию. Его сын находиться в Российской Федерации и присылает ему деньги. Но он не надеется на своего сына и сам имея свой бизнес, разводит коз и овец. Его младший сын помогает ему, он живет с ним и при покупке и  продаже скота помогает отвозить скот на рынок. Он благодарен КИВА за финансовую поддержку и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Sayfuddin is 54 years old. He fattens goats and also works as a shepherd on a collective farm.  There is a herd on the collective farm, which counts over 200 goats.  Having rich experience in livestock raising, Sayfuddin also takes his goats to pasture.  Taking into consideration harsh weather conditions, Sayfuddin leads his herd into the mountains, and in winter he brings the animals back. Sayfuddin's wife does not work but has a pension. 
Sayfuddin's son is in Russia. He sends his father some money. Sayfuddin is not, however, totally dependent on his son in terms of money. He has his own goat and sheep raising business.  Sayfuddin's youngest son lives with him and helps Sayfuddin take the livestock to and from the market when animals get bought or sold. Sayfuddin is grateful to KIVA for financial support and is looking forward to further collaboration.

loans.use: to buy a few goats

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica a atender la agricultura y ganadería, aprendió desde muy joven su padre le enseño, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado que serian tres novillas, ya que tiene una buena oferta y aprovechando que al final puede venderlos y generar más ganancias.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio, ir creciendo, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Humberto lives with his family, his wife and three sons.  He works tending to farming and livestock, which he learned when he was very young as his father taught him.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle, namely three heifers, as he has been offered a good deal and taking advantage of it means that ultimately he can sell them and generate more earnings.

His goal is to keep his business going and to grow it, and to improve his family's living conditions.


, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica a atender la agricultura y ganadería, aprendió desde muy joven su padre le enseño, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado que serian tres novillas, ya que tiene una buena oferta y aprovechando que al final puede venderlos y generar más ganancias.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio, ir creciendo, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, está soltera, vive con sus padres, la vivienda es familiar, ella es la que sostiene al hogar, el negocio de Rosa es la venta de hot dog y pupusas, estos negocios los atiende durante la semana, de lunes a sábado, los hot dog desde las 9:00am hasta las 6:00pm y las pupusas los sábados de 4:00pm a 7:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus ventas como salchichas, aderezos, pan especial, aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas, entre otros productos que son de mucha necesidad para ella.
Este préstamo le dará mayor seguridad para atender el negocio, brindando un mejor servicio y prosperando con sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and lives with her parents.  It’s a family household and she supports the home.  She sells hot dogs and pupusas during the week from Monday through Saturday; hot dogs from 9:00am to 6:00pm and pupusas from 4:00pm to 7:00pm on Saturdays.

She’s asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as sausages, dressings, special bread, cooking oil, cheese, fried pork rinds, and drinks among other things that she really needs.

This loan will provide her with a good opportunity to run her business, provide better service, and become more prosperous with her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El socio Pedro Jose; continua con su pequeño negocio en casa el socio continua prestando el servicio de alimento el esta aun trabajando con su esposa en la atencion de sus pension familiar y para personas independientes. El socio en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra d einsumos y de productos al por mayor como arroz en bolsas, azucar, aceeite en bidones, sal en sacos, fideos en caja.
texts.en:
This member is Pedro Jose; he continues with is small business in his home, where he continues providing meals.  He is still working with his wife in tending to their boarding house for families and individuals.

On this occasion, the member wants to invest his loan in purchasing supplies and products at wholesale, such as bags of rice, sugar, drums of oil, bags of salt, and boxes of noodles.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and products at wholesale, such as bags of rice, sugar, drums of oil, bags of salt, and boxes of noodles.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda  de 63 años es casada y tiene 4 hijos ya adultos que han formado su propia familia, es una mujer muy trabajadora que no le gusta depender de sus hijos ya que ella siempre ah trabajado para  apoyar a su esposo con los gastos. 

Amanda trabaja en una escuela que ofrece varios talleres; ella imparte clases de belleza y algunas ocasiones de manualidades, aparte tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años donde ofrece variedad de ropa para dama y caballero. En este momento pide el apoyo para compra ropa de temporada de frio y calor ya que se aproxima la nueva estación del año que es primavera por lo que quiere estar preparado con la ropa adecuada al clima.
texts.en:
Amanda, 63, is married and has four children who already are adults and have formed their own families.  She is a very hardworking woman who does not like to depend on her children because she always has worked to help her husband with the expenses.

Amanda works in a school that offers various workshops.  She gives classes on beauty and occasionally on handicrafts.  For four years she also has had a business selling used clothing where she offers a variety of clothing for women and men.

Right now she is requesting the loan to buy clothing for cold and hot weather because the new season is approaching, which is spring, and she wants to be prepared with clothing appropriate for the weather.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Reinaldo Ubaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es un hombre de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida rápida.

Su historia empezó con un amigo y luego decidí seguir solo porque me gusto cocinar y aquí estoy trabajando para salir adelante, su trabajo lo hace con un amigo todos los días de madrugada porque atiendo desde las 4 de la mañana, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casado, si tiene hijos estudia en escuela fiscal.

Su sueño más importante es quiero ponerme un local que sea seguro y crecer para darle mejoría a mi hija en su vida en adelante. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comidA  y asi comprar carnes, vegetales, verduras, bebidas.
texts.en:
Reinaldo, 44, has high hopes for growing his food sales business over the next few years

He tells us that he worked with a friend before striking out on his own.  He likes to cook, he says, so opening a food sales business was a good option for him.  He normally starts work at 4 in the morning.  Yes, he has trouble with crime; No, he's not married; Yes, he has one child, now in school.

Reinaldo's greatest wish is to open a restaurant.  He wants to make a better life for his daughter.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies for his food sales business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia desea invertir en su negocio de venta de quesos, en comprar por mayoreo ya que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar los quesos sin descapitalizar el ingreso de su negocio. 
Doña Alicia tiene ya mas de siete años dedicándose a la venta de quesos, tiene sus propios vendedores y en centros comerciales a quienes les vende. También quiere invertir en otros productos que son chorizo, carnes, especies, para tener más variedad de productos. 
Con las una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso para solventar sus gastos,  sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia.
texts.en:
Señora Alicia wants to invest in her business selling cheese, by purchasing at wholesale as they are offering her a very good price.  However, she does not have the necessary money to make the investment.

She is requesting a loan to purchase the cheese without decapitalizing the income of her business.

Doña Alicia has been selling cheese for more than seven years.  She has her own resellers in the commercial centers, to whom she sells.  She also wants to invest in other products, namely chorizo sausage, meat, and condiments to be able to have a greater variety of products.

She will repay the loan with part of the earnings that she gets from her business, as this is her source of income for covering her expenses.  Her children already have their own families.

loans.use: to purchase cheese for selling.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El socio  Abraham; continua con su negocio de comidas, el socio tambien tiene una pequeña pension familiar y el colabora a su esposa con la eatencion al publico en general, el socio desea poder invertir el prestamo en la compra de algunos viveres para el negocio el socio desea comprar arroz, aceite, entre otros productos para la elaboracion de los diferentes potajes y de este modo continuar apoyando en la educacion de sus hijos y tambien mantenerse activo. El socio requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, azucar, fideos entre otros.
texts.en: Our member, Abraham, operates a food sales business.  He and his wife also have a small "pension" [a kind of room rental business].  Abraham is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supples--cooking oil, rice, etc.--for his food sales business.  He makes and sells different kinds of stews.  The income from the business pays for his children's school fees and keeps him active.

loans.use: to stock his food sales business.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la sastrería, ella vive con sus cuatro hijos, su ocupación es la sastrería, confeccionando vestidos, trajes, pantalones, de este oficio ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas de variedad de colores y tipos, ya que es su principal materia que necesita para poder confeccionar sus prendas, este préstamo le ayudara para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de colores en telas, de esta manera mantener la preferencia de los clientes.
La aspiración de María es invertir en su negocio, para hacerlo más productivo, esto le ayudara para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María works doing sewing.  She lives with her four children and her occupation is being a seamstress: she sews clothes, suits, trousers, and by these means she has been able to move her family ahead in life.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of various colors and types of fabric, as this is the principal material that she needs in order to to be able to sew her clothing.  This loan will help her to offer her customers a variety of colors of fabric, and in this way to meet her customers' preferences.

María's goal is to invest in her business to make it more productive.  This will help her to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different colors and types of fabric.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and the three kids are kindergarten students. He started his carpentry business in 2007. He makes wooden tools, which are needed to build houses such as a housetop, door etc. His products are flawless and with modern design. Now he is well known for his work. His product demand is increasing. Therefore, he needs to renew his tools and equipment in order to work efficiently and fast. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have to work hard in order to support my children". He is requesting 300,000 MNT to purchase new equipment.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is married with three children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monaliza is 33 years old.

Monaliza has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Monaliza requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

Monaliza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Monaliza would like to save enough money to buy additional multi-cabs for her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport.business

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Madres Unidas
La Sra. Marleni tiene 32 años de edad,  es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, Marleni  actualmente es socio en la alcancía comunal “Madres Unidas” grupo  conformado por  8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Marleni trabaja en la preparación y venta al por mayor  de maní confitado y maní salado a su vez vende comida en las noches,  Marleni nos cuenta que su motivación para salir a delante es su familia y que trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en dia tiene,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   se ha comprado una casa prefabricada , sus hijos van a  la escuela. Marleni  ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos mani azucar etc. Marleni cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
This is the "Madres Unidas" communal bank. Marleni is 32, lives in a common-law relationship, and has two school-age children. Marleni is currently a member of the “Madres Unidas” group, made up of eight members who have a variety of small businesses. 

Marleni makes and sells sugar-coated and salted peanuts at wholesale, and at the same time sells food in the evenings. Marleni tells us that the  motivation that keeps her going is her family, and that she worked very hard to get what she has today. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has bought herself a prefabricated house, and her children go to school. 

Marleni has applied for a new loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, etc. Marleni will meet her goals through a lot of work and effort, and the Edaprospo loans will help her do this.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for the back-to-school season.

loans.name: Faamita

texts.en:
Faamita is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Faamita owns & operates a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling a variety of confectionaries such as cookies and cakes in the local community.  Faamita has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 900 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Faamita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faamita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Faamita is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST to continue expanding the business.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Faamita from SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking supplies to expand her bakery

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Amilcar; el socio tiene  2 menores hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad; El socio trabaja haciendo fisioterapias y rehabilitaciones a personas que lo requieran, el socio tiene su propio centro de fisio terapias; el socio  es kinesiologo y fisioterapeuta de profesion.  El socio desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de un equipo para implementar su consultorio. 


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Amilcar belongs to the Huayna Piccu communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Amilcar has two minor children, ages 8 and 3.  He works doing physical therapies and rehabilitations for people who need it.  He has his own physical therapy center.  He is a kinesiologist and a physical therapist by profession.  He wants to use the loan to buy equipment to set up in his physical therapy center.

He is grateful to those who are part of this dream through the loan.  He pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy equipment to set up in his physical therapy center.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Ruben has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Ruben has been a member of HSPFI for since 2002.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tuuipo

texts.en:
Tuuipo is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of SalelavaluTai.  She is married and has 9 school-aged children.  To make a living, Tuuipo  owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Tuuipo has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tuuipo  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuuipo  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2000 WST from SPBD.  She is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD. Tuuipo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue improving her business.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Soonalau

texts.en:
Soonalau is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Taga.  She is married and has 9 school-aged children.  To make a living, Soonalau owns & operates a fishing business, catching & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Soonalau has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Soonalau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Soonalau has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. Soonalau is now requesting a new loan of 1250 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD. Soonalau plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment and supplies

loans.name: Ferolini

texts.en:
Ferolini is a 26 -year-old woman who is married and has 3 children.  To make a living, Ferolini raises crops on a small plantation.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ferolini has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.  From these activities, Ferolini earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2009, Ferolini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ferolini is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies and equipment to increase the yield of her land.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD.  Ferolini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue expanding her plantation.

loans.use: buy farm supplies and equipment to grow taro

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 31 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.   Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, cream, sardines, snack foods, etc.  

Josefina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: La socia continua con con el negocio de artesnaia, la socia  tambien renta su casa a estudiantes y personas en general, ella tien ahora un stand y a entrado de lleno en el negocio de artesania en especial de trabajos hechos en arcilla para decoracion en su mayoria. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de artesania para la venta.
texts.en: This member continues working in her handicrafts business.  She also lets out rooms in her home to students and the general public.  She now has a stand and has entered fully into the handicrafts business, mainly selling decorative pottery.  She would like to invest her loan in buying handicrafts to sell.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Gladys Obdulia

texts.es: La socia continua enseñando a niños, la soica a logrado poner su tienda de abarrotes, y ella en este tiempo que esta de vacaciones escolares estuvo terminando de modificar su negocio de tiend a de abarrotes. La socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes y comprar arroz, fideos, azucar, harinas, aceite, mazamorras, leche entre otros productos basicos y de consumo diario. La socia deaea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: This member continues teaching children.  She has also managed to set up her grocery store.  Over the school vacation period, she managed to finish making modifications to her grocery store business.  She would like to stock her store and buy rice, noodles, flour, oil, 'mazamorras' (milky, corn pudding), milk and other basic household products which people use every day.  She would like to invest her loan in buying basic household products.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Falefoe

texts.en:
Falefoe is a 29-year-old woman who is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Falefoe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Falefoe has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Falefoe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Falefoe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 720 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Falefoe is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase more farm supplies & equipment.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD.  Falefoe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 53 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Rodilyn earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

Rodilyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 38-year-old married woman with 5 children.  The oldest child is 19 years old.  Myrna's husband works a as a farmer.

Myrna used to sell gasoline but decided to work with her husband and focus on farming.  She helps till their land and plant rice crops. Myrna also helps sell their harvest at their town's market. Mryna works hard to build their business. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs. Myrna hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family.  She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from hog raising.

Julieta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells vegetables like cabbages, carrots & potatoes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell..

loans.name: Fanny Betty

texts.es:
La mujer que ustedes pueden apreciar en la fotografía es Fanny, una mujer de 29 años, que tiene una pequeña de 5 años, a la cual ama y se desvive por estar pendiente de ella y darle toda la protección y cuidados que necesita. Por algunas razones personales Fanny se separó de su esposo y es por ello que decidió salir adelante sola con su hija.

Para poder solventar todos sus gastos, se dedica a la venta de calzados por catálogo desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha aprendido sobre el manejo de este tipo de negocio, en la actualidad ella labora un promedio de 8 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende entre 2 y 5 clientes. Para asegurarse de que sus clientes volverán a realizarle compras ella les brinda facilidades de pago como también la garantía necesaria de los productos vendidos, pero básicamente se desvela por brindar una buena atención.

Con la ayuda de este préstamo, ella podrá realizar la compra anticipada de varios zapatos para su venta y así disminuirá en el tiempo en la atención de los pedidos, cuando sus ganancias empiecen a mejorar realizará la compra de un exhibidor y logrando incrementar sus ventas logrará juntar el dinero suficiente para tener una casa propia para ella y su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Fanny is the woman in the photo.  She is 29 years old and has a 5 year old little one.  She loves her daughter very much, and she does her utmost to be vigilant and provide her with all of the necessary care.  For personal reasons Fanny separated from her husband.  Therefore, she decided to get ahead with only herself and her daughter.

In order to be able to pay for all of her expenses she has been selling footwear by catalog for two years.  During this time she has learned how to manage this type of business.  She currently works an average of eight hours a day.  During that time she tends to between two and five customers.

To make sure that her customers return to shop with her Fanny offers them easy payment arrangements.  She also provides the necessary guarantee of the products sold.  Basically she goes out of her way to provide good service.

With the help of this loan she will be able to buy, in advance, various shoes to sell.  This will cut down on the time the orders take to fill.  When her income starts to improve she will buy a showcase.  When she manages to increase her sales she will get enough money together to have her own house for herself and her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer and she works with her husband on their farm. She helps plant rice crops and sell their harvest. She also sells fish in her neighborhood.

Presentacion is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. She joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services.  Presentacion works hard to support her family. She hopes to have her own capital in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Lucel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Lucel is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future,Lucel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 40 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in the Philippines.  Eduardo provides motorela or motorcycle services, which he has been doing for five years. 

Eduardo is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy tools and pay for gasoline.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to purchase tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has had this business for eight years.

Nimfa is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy materials for fishing boat maintenance.  In the future, Nimfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat maintenance.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Conchita makes and sells snacks such as boiled corn and binaki (a native delicacy in Mindanao which is mainly made from corn).  She has had this business for 10 years. 

Conchita is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.   In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a hard-working farmer who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He has been tilling his land for more than 10 years. Vicente primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Vicente hopes to earn better and be able to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Flor De Jocote Group

texts.en:
The trust bank “Flor de Jocote” (Jocote is a fruit, which grows widely in the area) was formed in 2010 in a tiny rural village called Cruz Blanca, San Juan Sacatepequez, in the central highlands of Guatemala, where access is by dirt road. The group is very active and dynamic; it is composed of seven women, dedicated to various commercial and production activities, such as: sale of clothing, animal husbandry, and the sale of meat, which are sold in the community or the nearest market (20 minutes away from the village). All the members are neighbors and know one another.  This is their third loan cycle, and their two previous loans with Friendship Bridge were paid in full and on time. 

Maria Francisca, treasurer of the group, is forty-six years old, married and has four daughters. In recent years Maria Francisca has been a working with livestock, rather than weaving. She sells her products in the market nearby (20 minutes from where she lives) on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. Maria Francisca believes strongly in good education, although she did not have the opportunity to attend school herself, but she encourages her daughters, currently in kindergarten, 1st, 4th and 5th grades, to stay in school.  Her dream is that they graduate from high school and ultimately from college. 

With the new loan, Maria Francisca wants to increase her sales. She plans to add variety to her business, so she will buy more chickens, turkeys, ducks and pigs to meet her clients’ needs.
